overview: In 2008, having just graduated from Cornell, Dana Lampert co-founded the group collaboration website Wiggio.com. During a previous internship on Wall Street, Dana had seen how the large corporations were equipped with amazing tools for group communication - tools that the average consumer did not have access to. Therefore, he created Wiggio to bring that sort of functionality to the average person desiring an easier way to work together. Throughout 2010 Wiggio grew from about 350,000 to 600,000 users and in March of 2011, Wiggio launched a 2.0 version of its software and a brand new iPhone Application.
